From gopal at gopalarathnam.com  Sat Apr  1 00:06:49 2006
From: gopal at gopalarathnam.com (Gopalarathnam Venkatesan)
Date: Sat Apr  1 00:06:57 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] [OT] doubt in php
In-Reply-To: <442D65D0.8090000@kix.in>
References: <aec5a5f80603310914v2d576150w3390ff9057627028@mail.gmail.com>
	<442D65D0.8090000@kix.in>
Message-ID: <4cba61b90603311036t6581aa97n6d0af46bf4c9c89b@mail.gmail.com>

On 3/31/06, Anant Narayanan <anant@kix.in> wrote:
>
> If the header() function doesn't work for you (why?) you can try using
> HTML's <meta> tag.
>
> if ($someuser) {
>     echo "<meta HTTP-EQUIV=\"refresh\" content=2;url=\"somepage.php\">";
> } else {
>     echo "<meta HTTP-EQUIV=\"refresh\" content=2;url=\"otherpge.php\">";
> }
>

Chances are content would have been sent already before the headers
thats why its failing.  Also, its always advisable to put META tags in
the HEAD section of the document.

Like in the case of say, specifying the content type of the document,
if the META is not within the HEAD, browsers would reload the document
internally for using the specified content type.

--
Gopalarathnam Venkatesan
http://gopalarathnam.com/

From srini.it at gmail.com  Sat Apr  1 09:18:22 2006
From: srini.it at gmail.com (Srinivasan Sundararajan)
Date: Sat Apr  1 09:18:33 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] mails and postings
Message-ID: <328077850603311948s145d3cf5v972c4ae939a3d9d5@mail.gmail.com>

Dear friends: I have been seeing long thresds of technical / non-technical /
other (?) discussions. I am rather a new entrant to ILUGC, albeit with
official mandate to interact with anybody and everybody who is ineterested
in FOSS and in whom FOSS is interested. While I understand the passion many
of you have, let me quote (you must have had it umpteen times & I hope I
have done it correctly)

"Where is the knowledge lost in information
  Where is the wisdom lost in knowledge"

In this computer age, I am tempted to add "Where is the information lost in
data and where is the data lost in bits and bytes (and postings and mail
threads)".

As some of you suggested, let us give and meaningful subject line so that we
could decide whether to read thru or give it a miss. If I have to alert
specific persons [e.g., Raman or Sakthi or Bharthi], I would rather send a
mail to the personal id. If I am seeking some of your help in organizing
things, initial mail might be to the group, but I might switch to individual
modes.

We could possibly limit the thread level to , say 10?. Am sure, most of us
want to voice our opinion but I feel we need not react to each and every
matter raised. We had all seen the ads where people were getting submerged
in the mire of plastic bags and garbage. Let us not sink in the ocean of
words. Having been in tech/trade information projects (interacting with few
thousands of subscribers -- all before the advent of emails and internet), I
know how one could get buried deep in irrelevant info. The problem is what
is irrelevant for me could be extremely important to somebody else!

Thanks for patiently reading thru this mail -- I do not want long threads of
comments to follow this mail.(Am I being a megalomaniac thinking that
comments will follow?)
With best wishes, Srinivasan.

Dear all,
On 31 Apr 06, me and Thayagurajan conducted one day Seminar at Shri
Ramanujar Engg College, near Vandalur, Chennai.
We started with intro to FOSS, showed a live cd and did an install of
debian in the Forenoon. As usual there was good interaction with
students.

In the Afternoon I spent about two hours with 8 of the 3rd year
students with hands-on sesssion.

The students seem to be very interested and hope they will continue
exploring FOSS.

On behalf of ILUGC I thank management,faculty and students of Sri
Ramanujar Engg College.

Gentoo follows a "slotted" system. When I tried to upgrade my kernel to
2.6.16 I had both this and 2.6.15 as options. Only when I was completely
sure that my newer upgrade was working fine, I unmerged the 2.6.15 version.

I guess Debian/Ubuntu also retains the older kernel like Gentoo.

From andyetitmoves at gmail.com  Sun Apr  2 14:32:23 2006
From: andyetitmoves at gmail.com (Ramkumar R)
Date: Sun Apr  2 14:32:33 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] Problems with Kernel 2.6.16
In-Reply-To: <20060402084036.61970.qmail@web50211.mail.yahoo.com>
References: <9a9bfc170604020031i37b25e9h43dfd8d4171b757e@mail.gmail.com>
	<20060402084036.61970.qmail@web50211.mail.yahoo.com>
Message-ID: <9a9bfc170604020102j337e8296wf89a414a0f725db2@mail.gmail.com>

> When you do a kernel upgrade using your distro package
> manager, do they retain the previous kernels that are
> installed? How does Debian/Fedora Core/Ubuntu/any
> other distro handle this?

Firstly, just to help people trying to install custom kernels on
Debian, the right procedure is to use the following steps:

1) Install the kernel-package package (The doc provided is excellent)
2) Configure the kernel as you please, and make
3) Run make-kpkg in the top source directories. A sample command line would be:

make-kpkg --rootcmd fakeroot --revision custom.1 kernel_image
(You will need write permission in the parent directory)

I have some out-of-kernel modules for which Debian provides the source
as a package (which is good, as upgrades occur automatically). To
build them as well,

sudo make-kpkg --revision custom.1 modules-image

This will generate deb's for the kernel and a deb each for each
third-party module in the parent directory. Just use dpkg -i <debs> to
install them. This does everything right from installing the kernel,
updating grub etc. Each kernel is a *separate package* (unlike other
packages, where there is a single package with different version
numbers), and so installing a new kernel does not do anything to the
existing ones. The only destructive changes made are changing the
default kernel in grub to the one installed. So, you can still use the
other kernels.. If you don't like a kernel, just purge the
corresponding package.

It has been long since I have used other distros. I used to make &&
make install for non-distro kernels in Fedora... may be there are
cleaner methods which cooperate better with the distro package
manager.

Regards,
Ramkumar.

--
April 1: This is the day upon which we are reminded of
what we are on the other three hundred and sixty-four.
          -- Mark Twain, "Pudd'nhead Wilson's Calendar"

From binand at gmail.com  Sun Apr  2 11:14:11 2006
From: binand at gmail.com (Binand Sethumadhavan)
Date: Sun Apr  2 14:44:20 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] Problems with Kernel 2.6.16
In-Reply-To: <20060402084036.61970.qmail@web50211.mail.yahoo.com>
References: <9a9bfc170604020031i37b25e9h43dfd8d4171b757e@mail.gmail.com>
	<20060402084036.61970.qmail@web50211.mail.yahoo.com>
Message-ID: <d2a92d610604020114u1a1dfae4gab2cc97b7361cbcd@mail.gmail.com>

On 02/04/06, Shakthi Kannan <cyborg4k@yahoo.com> wrote:
> When you do a kernel upgrade using your distro package
> manager, do they retain the previous kernels that are
> installed? How does Debian/Fedora Core/Ubuntu/any
> other distro handle this?

RHEL's up2date has a configuration setting for this:

pkgsToInstallNotUpdate[comment]=A list of provides names or package
names of packages to install not update
pkgsToInstallNotUpdate=kernel;kernel-modules;

So, running "up2date kernel" will install the new version, not upgrade
it. The old version remains installed.

Binand

From cyborg4k at yahoo.com  Sun Apr  2 05:03:59 2006
From: cyborg4k at yahoo.com (Shakthi Kannan)
Date: Sun Apr  2 17:34:20 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] Problems with Kernel 2.6.16
In-Reply-To: <442F99E9.6040802@gmail.com>
Message-ID: <20060402120359.65583.qmail@web50214.mail.yahoo.com>

Hi guyz,

Thanks for your inputs.

--- "Ramkumar R" <andyetitmoves@gmail.com>wrote:
> 3) Run make-kpkg in the top source directories. A 
> sample command line 
> would be:

For Debian, I use these steps in the kernel sources
directory:

 make menuconfig
 make
 make-kpkg initrd binary-arch
 make-kpkg modules_image
 cd ..
 dpkg -i kernel-headers-2.x.x.deb
kernel-image-2.x.x.deb

--- Parthan SR <parth.technofreak@gmail.com> wrote:
> Test 2: How to do that ?!
> ( Also, I took the dmesg of current 2.6.14 kernel ,
> how to do the same 
> with 2.6.16 as i am not able to get atleast the
> console?)

You can boot into single user mode by passing the word
"single" to the kernel line in grub configuration. 

You can change the run-level in /etc/inittab in the
line:

 id:3:initdefault:

Even after booting into run-level 3, if you don't see
the console, you need to check the getty lines in the
same /etc/inittab:

 1:2345:respawn:/sbin/getty 38400 tty1

Even if this doesn't work for you with the new kernel,
then I think its crashed with an OOPS message or stuck
in a deadlock.

Regards,

SK

--
Shakthi Kannan, MS
Software Engineer, Hexaware Technologies
[E]: cyborg4k at yahoo dot com   [M]: (91) 98407-87007
[W]: http://www.shakthimaan.com  [L]: Chennai, India

From cyborg4k at yahoo.com  Sun Apr  2 05:23:32 2006
From: cyborg4k at yahoo.com (Shakthi Kannan)
Date: Sun Apr  2 17:53:39 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] Creating serial device files in mandriva2006
In-Reply-To: <edd8ce540604020516q83f6b6elfd49279e90062b45@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <20060402122332.38086.qmail@web50211.mail.yahoo.com>

Hi Adarsh,

--- "Adarsh V.P" <vpadarsh@gmail.com> wrote:
> hi guys,
> can any one help me to create serial device files in

You mean /dev/tty* ? In recent distros, with HAL,
udevd, if your hardware is present, and detected,
these daemons should create the device files for you.

crw-rw----  1 root dialout 4,  64 2006-04-02 17:24
/dev/ttyS0
crw-rw----  1 root dialout 4,  65 2006-04-02 17:24
/dev/ttyS1

Or use the mknod command to create the device files as
root:

 mknod /dev/ttyS0 c 4 64

> linux and to make it work.

What are you trying to accomplish? What is your
hardware?

SK

Software Engineer, Hexaware Technologies

Vasudevan A wrote:

>su -
>cd /etc/yum.repos.d/
>wget http://people.redhat.com/davej/kernels/Fedora/FC5/kernels.repo
>yum install rpm-build
>yum install kernel-devel -y
>yum update kernel kernel-devel -y
>mkdir /root/nvidia
>cd /root/nvidia
>wget http://www.leemhuis.info/files/fedorarpms/MISC.lvn/graphics/xorg-x11-drv-nvidia-1.0.8178-0.lvn.5.i386.rpm
>wget http://www.leemhuis.info/files/fedorarpms/MISC.lvn/graphics/nvidia-kmod-1.0.8178-0.lvn.3.2.6.15_1.1881_FC5.src.rpm
>reboot
>select the new kernel, then:
>su -
>cd /root/nvidia
>rpmbuild --rebuild --target `uname -m` nvidia-kmod-*.src.rpm
>cp -a /usr/src/redhat/RPMS/`uname -m`/kmod-nvidia* ./
>rpm -Uvh kmod-*nvidia*-1.0.8178-0.*.rpm
>xorg-x11-drv-nvidia-1.0.8178-0.lvn.5.i386.rpm
>modprobe nvidia
>chkconfig nvidia-glx on
>service nvidia-glx start
>nvidia-xconfig
>reboot
>  
>

> Then, it  started booting up... within a few
> seconds.. it hanged out 
> with the last thing saying "Kenrel Panic!". I could
> see some attempts to 
> mount and some failures. It just hanged there. Where
> did I go wrong and

It doesn't mount your partitions properly? Can you
post the exact error messages prior to the panic?
Either no support for you filesystem on your hard
disk, or no proper drivers for IDE/SATA or any other.
 
> I din't know how to append tht GRUB arguments in the
> options it gives in 
> the grub menu, by pressing "e" instead of C.. ie
> where to append tht "3" 
> which ramkumar said. 

He meant the "kernel" line. If you add "single" to the
kernel line, it will boot into run-level 1.

From cyborg4k at yahoo.com  Sun Apr  2 07:32:23 2006
From: cyborg4k at yahoo.com (Shakthi Kannan)
Date: Sun Apr  2 20:02:46 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] Installing Nvidia driver in FC5
In-Reply-To: <442FD168.1080204@gmail.com>
Message-ID: <20060402143224.90486.qmail@web50215.mail.yahoo.com>

Hi Parthan,

--- Parthan SR <parth.technofreak@gmail.com> wrote:
> Taking the guidelines from it for adding the NVIDIA
> driver to my current 
> FC4 with kernel-2.6.14 ( I donno how can I do it
> with my 
> not-up-and-running 2.6.16)

Your running kernel is a binary image in /boot. What
you are compiling is source code, against the kernel
sources present in your hard disk.

> I have already installed the new kernel (thru yum
> extender, a GUI for YUM). So i need not do i t again
> :) ??

Recompile the driver against the kernel sources.
 
> U mean reboot into the new 2.6.16 which is not
> up-n-running yet or my 
> current 2.6.14 ??

After you have patched the driver, compiled with the
kernel sources, to test the new kernel, you need to
reboot with it.
 
> When i am not able to be even in command line of my
> 2.6.16, will doing 
> this help me ??

Boot into the running 2.6.14 or any other kernel, then
compile your 2.6.16 kernel, and reboot with the newly
compiled kernel.
 
> am still at the
> middle part of the 
> learning curve :(

Everybody who makes an attempt to learn goes through
it.

Have fun,

SK

From cyborg4k at yahoo.com  Sun Apr  2 11:05:11 2006
From: cyborg4k at yahoo.com (Shakthi Kannan)
Date: Sun Apr  2 23:35:45 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] Problems with Kernel 2.6.16
In-Reply-To: <442FEC28.3070206@gmail.com>
Message-ID: <20060402180511.94466.qmail@web50214.mail.yahoo.com>

Hi Parthan,

--- Parthan SR <parth.technofreak@gmail.com> wrote:
>    How did i get the error msg ? any log files ? i
> did take a dmesg output
>    from my current kernel 2.6.14 after the kernel
> panic occured with 2.6.16.

Not for 2.6.14, the last kernel messages for 2.6.16
that had the kernel panic. You can write it down.

>    What does dmesg actually tell  about and how does
> it get appended, ie,
>    will it get appended with new messages at every
> reboot ? 

syslogd, klogd writes them to /var/log/messages for
the successful boots, not for the paniced kernel.

> Is it common for
>    any number of kernels you can run for a single
> distro ?

Sure. At any instant, only one kernel runs.
 
>    Can you give me an example ? I am not
> understanding it quite right, where
>    to append as there are 3 lines in it  :(

When grub loads, press 'e' to edit, move to the kernel
line using arrow keys, and press 'e' to edit the line.
Move to the end of the line and type "single". Now
press 'b' to boot. It should boot into single user
mode.

We'll have a discussion on kernel compilation during
our next meet.

Have fun,

SK

--
Shakthi Kannan, MS
Software Engineer, Hexaware Technologies
[E]: cyborg4k at yahoo dot com   [M]: (91) 98407-87007
[W]: http://www.shakthimaan.com  [L]: Chennai, India

From cyborg4k at yahoo.com  Sun Apr  2 11:10:33 2006
From: cyborg4k at yahoo.com (Shakthi Kannan)
Date: Sun Apr  2 23:40:54 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] Installing Nvidia driver in FC5
In-Reply-To: <442FED43.2040100@gmail.com>
Message-ID: <20060402181033.32652.qmail@web50203.mail.yahoo.com>

Hi Parthan,

--- Parthan SR <parth.technofreak@gmail.com> wrote:
> Shakthi,
> Can you give me some links which details about this
> process, 

For driver compilation, follow the docs provided by
the driver vendor. They usually give a README or
howto.

> so I can 
> give it a read and dont make big msitakes in the
> process of trying it on 
> my own :) 

You can't learn without making mistakes :)

> Is it the process explained in LDD 3rd
> edition ?

Sure. It has instructions on how to compile a driver
for 2.6 kernels.

For 2.6 kernel compilation, I just use:

 make clean
 make menuconfig
 make
 make modules_install
 make install

Check this too:

http://www.linuxforum.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=152070

Also google for Linux kernel compilation documents.

Have fun,

SK

References: <20060402084036.61970.qmail@web50211.mail.yahoo.com>
Message-ID: <1144024921.3783.82.camel@sundaram.pnq.redhat.com>

On Sun, 2006-04-02 at 00:40 -0800, Shakthi Kannan wrote:
> Hi Ramkumar,
> 
> --- Ramkumar R <andyetitmoves@gmail.com> wrote:
> > 2.6.16-beyond1 keeps oopsing for me... so I am back
> > to
> > 2.6.15-archck2... perhaps you can see if you too get
> > oops messages in
> > the syslog, and roll back if that is the case...
> 
> When you do a kernel upgrade using your distro package
> manager, do they retain the previous kernels that are
> installed? How does Debian/Fedora Core/Ubuntu/any
> other distro handle this?

Till FC4, Fedora doesnt remove older kernels at all by default. FC5 has
a yum plugin enabled by default that retains the current+ last two
kernels. Configurable in /etc/yum/pluginconf.d/installonlyn.conf. 

Rahul

From trshash84 at gmail.com  Mon Apr  3 09:26:12 2006
From: trshash84 at gmail.com (T.R.Shashwath)
Date: Mon Apr  3 09:26:19 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] Choosing a lan card for ethernet interface
In-Reply-To: <5580629a0604021801p1e4cef73h5bc55a490030c38b@mail.gmail.com>
References: <5580629a0604021801p1e4cef73h5bc55a490030c38b@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <200604030926.12245.trshash84@gmail.com>

On Monday 03 April 2006 06:31, Ashok Gautham J. wrote:
> Thanks a lot for your excellent advice a few weeks ago for my query
> (Choosing a broadband connection)
>         I chose Airtel 500+ (256 kbps) with unlimited niightime and a
> rental modem . It turned out that my computer did not have something
> called ethernet card. So the airtel guys gave me a usb connection to
> my computer through the same modem ( Beetel 220BX. They told me that I
> could work on windows with the USB style modem, but for linux I needed
> the Ethernet card( or lan card) (dunno what their words confused me a
> bit.). I am still searching for a distro I like, I think gento 2006.0
> will do the trick, but in any case I want an ethernet ( or lan
> whichever is right) card that is supported by most( better if it is
> all ) distros. Can anybody suggest one.
> Thanks in advance ,
> Ashok.

Ethernet, technically - LAN could include things like wireless and token 
ring... Not that it matters anymore, since most wired LAN is ethernet and 
most wireless is 802.11.

Almost any ethernet card is supported, but I've found one or two cards that 
just refuse to work. For example, the Zebronics card with a Realtek chipset 
seems to have enough modifications to make it stop working with the drivers 
on the kernel. There are one or two other cards like that, which refuse to 
work, but generally, most cards with an RTL8139 chipset should work. Also, 
anything with a Winbond or an NE2000 type chipset.

You can also use a USB modem, if it's a Globespan chipset (some other chipsets 
also, but Globespan is what I've used), but I recommend that you don't go 
that way.

Gentoo is an excellent distro to use (well, I use it! :-) ), but it's also got 
a really crazy learning curve. If you're prepared to stick it out when it 
gets difficult, Gentoo is fine. But if you need something that Just Works, 
I'd suggest that you start with Ubuntu and change the repositories to Debian.

Shash
-- 
"Where shall  I  begin, please your Majesty ?" he asked.
"Begin at the beginning,", the King said, very gravely, 
"and go on till you come to the end: then stop."

ttyS04 at port 0x5000 (irq = 74) is a 16550A
Redundant entry in serial pci_table.  Please send the output of
lspci -vv, this message (1522,0100,1522,0d00)
and the manufacturer and name of serial board or modem board
to serial-pci-info@lists.sourceforge.net.

ILUGC Meet (Apr 8th):-
======================

Time : Sat Apr 8 15:00 IST 2006 
Venue: ADI-TeNeT Seminar Hall,
       #CSD 320, ESB, IIT-Madras.

Visit: http://www.chennailug.org/location-tenet.php

Talk 1 : Mozilla RAD Platform (1Hr)

Speaker: Gopalarathnam Venkatesan

Abstract:

The Mozilla Platform is a large software development tool that is a
modern blend of XML document processing, scripting languages, and
software objects. It is used to create interactive, user-focused
applications. This talk also covers building Mozilla.

Talk 2: USB and GNU/Linux - An Overview (30Min)

Speaker: Shakthi Kannan

Abstract : 

Introduction about the USB Support implemented at Kernel & User space
Level and how it can be used in GNU/Linux System.

Bye :)
-- 
Bharathi S

From vamlists at gmx.net  Mon Apr  3 14:03:22 2006
From: vamlists at gmx.net (Vamsee Kanakala)
Date: Mon Apr  3 14:03:37 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] Choosing a lan card for ethernet interface
In-Reply-To: <200604030926.12245.trshash84@gmail.com>
References: <5580629a0604021801p1e4cef73h5bc55a490030c38b@mail.gmail.com>
	<200604030926.12245.trshash84@gmail.com>
Message-ID: <4430DDD2.8000106@gmx.net>

T.R.Shashwath wrote:

>gets difficult, Gentoo is fine. But if you need something that Just Works, 
>I'd suggest that you start with Ubuntu and change the repositories to Debian.
>
>  
>
I'm not sure I would recommend changing repositories to Debian. Ubuntu, 
though it relies on Debian's packaging system, has a different set of 
packages and things like Firefox version are pretty locked down (for 
example - if you try to uninstall firefox, gnome-volume-manager and its 
friends will also disappear).

This is because Ubuntu releases are very well tested, and the won't 
change until the next release (except for bug fix updates). I'm guessing 
Bad Things Happen(TM) when you mix up both repositories (and God forbid, 
you set it to unstable).

Use something like Automatix if you want the latest stuff that's missing 
in Breezy.


Vamsee.

From rs2003 at gmail.com  Mon Apr  3 14:26:39 2006
From: rs2003 at gmail.com (R.Subramanian (RS))
Date: Mon Apr  3 14:26:54 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] tech and not-tech
In-Reply-To: <Pine.LNX.4.44.0604031139540.2391-100000@bharathi.midascomm.com>
References: <7bf1bec50604022253p13081250k7adf9e7ea5ad7493@mail.gmail.com>
	<Pine.LNX.4.44.0604031139540.2391-100000@bharathi.midascomm.com>
Message-ID: <7a7d6df30604030156s9a2b8d3g881b649c5b86449f@mail.gmail.com>

On 4/3/06, Bharathi Subramanian <sbharathi@midascomm.com> wrote:
>
> AFAIK, in the past 6 Years, Person is thrown away from the list, only
> for the following reasons. Not for anything else.
>
> 1. Mailbox is in Full State and mails are continuously bounce
>   back to server.
> 2. Spam the mailing list.
>

I have been watching this conversation on tech and non tech for quite some
time.
Would like to add my views on a few basic points.

Most of the users of all tech products are non tech people.
So, a hi tech product which was not presented properly to the actual end
users
will ultimately become use(r)less in spite of all its technical marvels.

On the other hand, if all the end users want a new tech product, they will
encourage and support the development of the technology and  the product
will some how be made available. Because Need is the MOTHER of all
inventions.

Numerous example can be found for this. In short relevance
Micro$oft's growth is in covering the first point well.
and Linux's growth is in serving  the second point well.

It will be Great if Linux addresses the first point also.

ex: Becoming more and more user friendly . ( for the non tech user of
course)

U and me may be comfortable even with the cli. But we must understand that
than the technical superiority of Linux unfriendlyness is actually what
attracts the non tech user. Without the non tech end user's support, any
product is use(r)less.

The point : It is the non-tech that determines the success of the tech.

Then about the coup in b-lug and related discussions :
Not to worry too much about this.
They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety
deserve neither liberty nor safety.  -Benjamin Franklin

Cheers
RS
From urwithsudheer at gmail.com  Mon Apr  3 15:11:25 2006
From: urwithsudheer at gmail.com (sudheer)
Date: Mon Apr  3 15:11:32 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] Block device driver, non-Interrupt drivem
Message-ID: <4430EDC5.4030701@gmail.com>

Hi All,

I am working for a  block device driver. The existing code is an 
interrupt-driven block  driver and  now wanted to make it as  a 
non-interrupt driven driver.

I have commented the "request_irq" function and the "interrupt enabling 
function"  in the driver  while initializing the module and it gets 
loaded well. When i try to read a sector , the control doesn't come to 
the user back though it reads the sector data and prints it correctly.

Do anyone have a sample code for non-interrupt  driven block driver or a 
pointer in the net.  I am in doubt wether the spinlocks  are causing  a  
deadlock, but not sure.

Thanks in advance.
Sudheer

From parth.technofreak at gmail.com  Mon Apr  3 21:55:15 2006
From: parth.technofreak at gmail.com (Parthan SR)
Date: Mon Apr  3 21:52:53 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] Installing Nvidia driver in Kenrel 2.6.16
In-Reply-To: <20060402181033.32652.qmail@web50203.mail.yahoo.com>
References: <20060402181033.32652.qmail@web50203.mail.yahoo.com>
Message-ID: <44314C6B.2080501@gmail.com>

The testing time still prevades...

As i was resolved to make my kernel 2.6.16 up and running in X, i tried 
out the following 3 things, one after another. But all in vain!

1. Following Vasudevan's advice of installing the nvidia driver, which 
he had proposed for FC5, i tried the procedure he had proposed in his 
earlier mail. But unfortunately wget failed, as the site owner has moved 
the nvidia-driver rpms out of his collection. I checked it manually in 
browser where he doesnt have the rpms for nvidia-driver and he had 
indeed specified that he has moved them off. He had given a link which 
openned new doors.

2. The leading link suggested me to use "Yum Install" to get the 
drivers. Unfortunately all the repos i had specified in my yumm failed 
with the driver.

3. Googling for "Installing nvidia-driver in FC4" took me to few good 
sites where the ncidia driver isntallation were neatly given.

I manually downloaded the file from the website ( ) which is " 
NVIDIA-Linux-x86-1.0-8178-pkg1.run"

They had suggested to run this file with a -aqn option for buiding the 
nvidia driver module into the kernel modules.

I logged in as single user into 2.6.16 and tried the following,

$ su
# cd /root/nvidia
# ./NVIDIA-Linux-x86-1.0-8178-pkg1.run -aqn

This started the kernel build screen, it started building the kernel but 
failed saying that it couldnot build the proposed ncidia-driver modules. 
I now have the nvidia-installer log which tells what happenned during 
the driver installation/module build process.

I hereby put the nvidia-install log. Can anyone help me in figuring out 
what went wrong and why the driver module didn't build up ?!

BIOS - e820 : 0000000000009fe00 - 00000000000a0000 (reserved)
BIOS - e820 : 00000000000f0000 - 0000000000010000 (reserved)
BIOS - e820 : 0000000000010000 - 0000000007ef0000 (usable)
BIOS - e820 : 0000000007ef0000 - 0000000007ef3000 (ACPI NVS)
BIOS - e820 : 0000000007ef3000 - 0000000007f00000 (ACPI data)
BIOS - e820 : 0000000007f00000 - 0000000000010000 (reserved)
BIOS - e820 : 0000000fec000000 - 0000000100000000 (reserved)

126MB LOWMEM available
found SMP MP-table at 000f51f0
DMI 2.3 present  

(K.BASKAR)

From cyborg4k at yahoo.com  Mon Apr  3 10:10:03 2006
From: cyborg4k at yahoo.com (Shakthi Kannan)
Date: Mon Apr  3 22:40:41 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] Installing Nvidia driver in Kenrel 2.6.16
In-Reply-To: <44314C6B.2080501@gmail.com>
Message-ID: <20060403171003.83187.qmail@web50201.mail.yahoo.com>

Hi Parthan,

--- Parthan SR <parth.technofreak@gmail.com> wrote:
/tmp/selfgz1410/NVIDIA-Linux-x86-1.0-8178-pkg1/usr/src/nv/os-interface.c:137
5: error: ?struct task_struct? has no member named
?rlim?

Says it all. 

rlim is of type struct rlimit, declared in struct
signal_struct in include/linux/sched.h in 2.6 kernels,
not in struct task_struct.

http://lxr.linux.no/source/include/linux/sched.h#L331

Only in 2.4 kernels, struct rlimit was embedded in
struct task_struct:

http://lxr.linux.no/source/include/linux/sched.h?v=2.4.20#L382

Report it to the nvidia developers.

SK

--
Shakthi Kannan
http://www.shakthimaan.com

Enlightenment would be the best choice.
Check out : http://www.elivecd.org/
There is an install to HDD option available in elive. But SATA is not
supported.

GS card and it worked fine.

On 4/4/06, Karthikeyan Sabhanatarajan <karthiknatrajan@gmail.com> wrote:
>
> I would like to know which is the best Eyecandy desktop available for
> Linux
>    ...
>    One of my friends has put his desktop shot ..
>    I dunno what Eyecandy he is using ..
>    XFCE is the one. I know . .
>    CAn anyone temme what Eyecandy he is using . I also want to know which
> is
>    the best Eyecand i can use
>    photos1.blogger.com/blogger/6601/150/400/Audacious_Eclair.jpg


Its Xfce. Xfce is good interms of Graphics. It does not occupy much memory.
If you try Xfce as default as in FedoraCore and RedHat systems, you wont be
experiencing the look and feel of Xfce. You may need to change the User
Interface Settigns in those. But take the latest version, install them (Xfce
comes with a very good graphical installer!) and experience the best out of
it.

I am using Xfce for some time,i see the KDE and Gnome apps loading faster. I
wonder how is that happening as we can see if we try to openn KDE apps in
Gnome, it takes little time to come up.

Karthikeyan Sabhanatarajan

> managed to find the 
> way once, the instructions are still confusing

There is another way (simple, I hope):

1. When coming from the IIT-M main gate, come to
Gajendra Circle.

2. Take a LEFT at Gajendra Circle and proceed further.
You'll pass Central Lecture Theater (on the right),
but, keep going straight. 

3. Take the first RIGHT.

4. Keep going straight and take the second RIGHT. You
will have the "Center for Intelligent Optical
Networking" building on the right. 

5. Come to the 3rd floor, room CSD #320 :)

SK

From akumar at ee.iitm.ac.in  Tue Apr  4 17:36:29 2006
From: akumar at ee.iitm.ac.in (Kumar Appaiah)
Date: Tue Apr  4 17:23:13 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] [Tip] Renaming files
Message-ID: <20060404120629.GA5531@localhost>

Hello! I thought people might find this tip useful. Often, we find
that we have many files with spaces in the filenames (moreso when they
are got from a Windoze user). Now, I find it very difficult to use
those files keeping the spaces in the names intact. So, I use
something like the following one liner to convert all spaces to `_'
(underscore) in the file names

for i in *jpg; do mv "$i" "`echo "$i"|sed 's/ /_/g'`"; done

Similar solutions with better error checking can be written. You can
also code this in Perl, Python or even AWK. But, this works...

Hope you found this useful.

Kumar
-- 
Kumar Appaiah,
462, Jamuna Hostel,
Indian Institute of Technology Madras,
Chennai - 600 036

Subject: [Ilugc] using sed
Message-ID: <a54a308e0604040506k6d0f239ey603e1b94130bf1d8@mail.gmail.com>

Hi all,

I want to change the line,

GraphicalTheme=Bluecurve

in gdm.conf to GraphicalTheme=<my-theme> using sed. How to achieve this?.

I tried, sed -e 's/GraphicalTheme=/GraphicalTheme=<my-theme>/ gdm.conf', but
the line does not change here.Only the pattern changes.

Thanks in advance.

From andyetitmoves at gmail.com  Tue Apr  4 17:39:21 2006
From: andyetitmoves at gmail.com (Ramkumar R)
Date: Tue Apr  4 17:39:30 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] [Tip] Renaming files
In-Reply-To: <20060404120629.GA5531@localhost>
References: <20060404120629.GA5531@localhost>
Message-ID: <9a9bfc170604040509m521cfe8cl98eb73aa484d7644@mail.gmail.com>

> for i in *jpg; do mv "$i" "`echo "$i"|sed 's/ /_/g'`"; done

this is perhaps more efficient... not posix compliant though (works on
zsh, bash)

for i in *.jpg; do mv "$i" "${i// /-}"; done

or in true zsh style:

for i (*.jpg) mv "$i" "${i// /-}"

or the rename on a debian box (i used to encounter a diff. rename when
i was on fedora, this is the perl based one)

rename 'y/ /-/' *.jpg

--
April 1: This is the day upon which we are reminded of
what we are on the other three hundred and sixty-four.
          -- Mark Twain, "Pudd'nhead Wilson's Calendar"
From gopal at gopalarathnam.com  Tue Apr  4 17:45:28 2006
From: gopal at gopalarathnam.com (Gopalarathnam Venkatesan)
Date: Tue Apr  4 17:45:37 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] using sed
In-Reply-To: <a54a308e0604040506k6d0f239ey603e1b94130bf1d8@mail.gmail.com>
References: <a54a308e0604040506k6d0f239ey603e1b94130bf1d8@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <4cba61b90604040515s6f1c1e74id8a77f198506185d@mail.gmail.com>

On 4/4/06, Chakkaradeep C C <chaks.yoper@gmail.com> wrote:
> Hi all,
>
> I want to change the line,
>
> GraphicalTheme=Bluecurve
>
> in gdm.conf to GraphicalTheme=<my-theme> using sed. How to achieve this?.
>
> I tried, sed -e 's/GraphicalTheme=/GraphicalTheme=<my-theme>/ gdm.conf', but
> the line does not change here.Only the pattern changes.
>
> Thanks in advance.

The newer versions of sed (at least GNU sed) has the "change in place
feature" which is supported using the -i option.

Or, you can use:

shell> ed gdm.conf <<!
1,$s/Graphical Theme=Bluecurve/Graphical Theme=<my-theme>/g
w
q
!

HTH.


PS.
Read ed(1), sed(1).

--
Gopalarathnam Venkatesan
http://gopalarathnam.com/
From andyetitmoves at gmail.com  Tue Apr  4 17:47:31 2006
From: andyetitmoves at gmail.com (Ramkumar R)
Date: Tue Apr  4 17:47:41 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] using sed
In-Reply-To: <a54a308e0604040506k6d0f239ey603e1b94130bf1d8@mail.gmail.com>
References: <a54a308e0604040506k6d0f239ey603e1b94130bf1d8@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <9a9bfc170604040517v65318418i924133e3e8d22ac3@mail.gmail.com>

> I tried, sed -e 's/GraphicalTheme=/GraphicalTheme=<my-theme>/ gdm.conf', but
> the line does not change here.Only the pattern changes.

sed -e 's/\s*GraphicalTheme\s*=.*/GraphicalTheme=foobar/' gdm.conf

the operational part of the change is the .* at the end. those \s* may
be necessary for parsing any legal gdm.conf in particular.

--
April 1: This is the day upon which we are reminded of
what we are on the other three hundred and sixty-four.
          -- Mark Twain, "Pudd'nhead Wilson's Calendar"

On Thursday 30 Mar 2006 3:43 pm, Binand Sethumadhavan wrote:
> This is a double-edged sword. I personally distrust any of these
> "comprehensive" tools after some bad experiences with linuxconf
> (way back in '97 or so). Their main problem is that they simply
> do not have the manpower or resources to keep up to date with the
> vast variety of software out there. For example, how many mail
> servers does webmin support? sendmail? qmail? postfix? exim?
> courier? Even if it does, which versions? Does it support
> sendmail 8.11, 12 and 13 (all three very common on the internet)?

i find that in order to do anything non-trivial with the gui tools 
you have to know enough to do it without the tool. And if you know 
enough for that, you dont need the tool. The only thing i have ever 
succeeded in doing properly with webmin is to manage users and 
groups and to add/edit/delete cron jobs

Or, just use rename:
rename <from> <to> <files>

For example,
rename " " "" *.jpg

I want to enable xdcmp flag Enable to true in gdm.conf. What i do, i get all

the words "from" to "until" and replace. But unfortunately it seems to be
not working...no idea why...here is the command,

sed -e '/[xdmcp]/,/HonorIndirect=/ { s/\<\Enable=\>/Enable=false/g }'
/etc/X11/gdm/gdm.conf

any idea how to make it work?

Thanks in advance.

Date: Wed Apr  5 10:22:35 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] using sed
In-Reply-To: <a54a308e0604040611i2b5cd3dbx9a94962263face8f@mail.gmail.com>
References: <a54a308e0604040506k6d0f239ey603e1b94130bf1d8@mail.gmail.com>
	<9a9bfc170604040517v65318418i924133e3e8d22ac3@mail.gmail.com>
	<a54a308e0604040611i2b5cd3dbx9a94962263face8f@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <a54a308e0604042152q148126b9t9f6e9ae0d9c35263@mail.gmail.com>

Hi all,

On 4/4/06, Chakkaradeep C C <chaks.yoper@gmail.com> wrote:
>
> Hi all,
>
> On 4/4/06, Ramkumar R <andyetitmoves@gmail.com> wrote:
> >
> > > I tried, sed -e 's/GraphicalTheme=/GraphicalTheme=<my-theme>/ gdm.conf',
> > but
> > > the line does not change here.Only the pattern changes.
> >
> > sed -e 's/\s*GraphicalTheme\s*=.*/GraphicalTheme=foobar/' gdm.conf
>
>
> Thanks a lot!, it worked. But where did you manage to get these commands
> of sed?...am googling but am not able to get a gud tutorial of sed
> commands....
>
> Now am stuck up with another command...
>
> I want to enable xdcmp flag Enable to true in gdm.conf. What i do, i get
> all lines between the words "[xdmcp]" and "HonorIndirect=", and try to
> replace that Enable line to Enable=true in those lines. I managed to get
> help from http://sed.sourceforge.net/sedfaq4.html#s4.20 as how to get all
> line between the words "from" to "until" and replace. But unfortunately it
> seems to be not working...no idea why...here is the command,
>
> sed -e '/[xdmcp]/,/HonorIndirect=/ { s/\<\Enable=\>/Enable=false/g }'
> /etc/X11/gdm/gdm.conf
>
> any idea how to make it work?
>

I have got some idea now. I get the line number of the [xdmcp] in the
gdm.conf using the commands,

grep -n -F "[xdmcp]" /etc/X11/gdm/gdm.conf | awk -F: '{print $1}'

i get 177

So now, if i do a sed like this,

sed -e '177,190 s/Enable=.*/Enable=true/;' /etc/X11/gdm/gdm.conf > gdm.new

It works perfect !. Now am not able to pass this 177 to sed as a variable. I
tried all kinds of tips and tricks as given here
http://sed.sourceforge.net/sedfaq4.html#s4.23 , but am not able to arrive at
the proper result.

Have anybody tried passing variables as commands to sed?

Thanks in advance.

Thanks in advance.

From chaks.yoper at gmail.com  Wed Apr  5 10:34:57 2006
From: chaks.yoper at gmail.com (Chakkaradeep C C)
Date: Wed Apr  5 10:35:05 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] using sed [SOLVED]
Message-ID: <a54a308e0604042204t4c5eb35fh5bcd736b25f45fd3@mail.gmail.com>

Hi all,

On 4/5/06, Chakkaradeep C C <chaks.yoper@gmail.com> wrote:
>
> Hi all,
>
> On 4/4/06, Chakkaradeep C C <chaks.yoper@gmail.com> wrote:
>
> > Hi all,
> >
> > On 4/4/06, Ramkumar R < andyetitmoves@gmail.com> wrote:
> > >
> > > > I tried, sed -e 's/GraphicalTheme=/GraphicalTheme=<my-theme>/
> > > gdm.conf', but
> > > > the line does not change here.Only the pattern changes.
> > >
> > > sed -e 's/\s*GraphicalTheme\s*=.*/GraphicalTheme=foobar/' gdm.conf
> >
> >
> > Thanks a lot!, it worked. But where did you manage to get these commands
> > of sed?...am googling but am not able to get a gud tutorial of sed
> > commands....
> >
> > Now am stuck up with another command...
> >
> > I want to enable xdcmp flag Enable to true in gdm.conf. What i do, i get
> > all lines between the words "[xdmcp]" and "HonorIndirect=", and try to
> > replace that Enable line to Enable=true in those lines. I managed to get
> > help from http://sed.sourceforge.net/sedfaq4.html#s4.20 as how to get
> > all line between the words "from" to "until" and replace. But unfortunately
> > it seems to be not working...no idea why...here is the command,
> >
> > sed -e '/[xdmcp]/,/HonorIndirect=/ { s/\<\Enable=\>/Enable=false/g }'
> > /etc/X11/gdm/gdm.conf
> >
> > any idea how to make it work?
> >
>
> I have got some idea now. I get the line number of the [xdmcp] in the
> gdm.conf using the commands,
>
> grep -n -F "[xdmcp]" /etc/X11/gdm/gdm.conf | awk -F: '{print $1}'
>
> i get 177
>
> So now, if i do a sed like this,
>
> sed -e '177,190 s/Enable=.*/Enable=true/;' /etc/X11/gdm/gdm.conf > gdm.new
>
> It works perfect !. Now am not able to pass this 177 to sed as a variable.
> I tried all kinds of tips and tricks as given here
> http://sed.sourceforge.net/sedfaq4.html#s4.23 , but am not able to arrive
> at the proper result.
>
> Have anybody tried passing variables as commands to sed?
>

It worked at last !. The command is,

 export B=`grep -n -F "[xdmcp]" /etc/X11/gdm/gdm.conf | awk -F: '{print
$1}'` | sed -e ''"$B"',190 s/Enable=.*/Enable=true/;' /etc/X11/gdm/gdm.conf
> gdm.new

It was a bit tricky here from my previous ways of putting the value into the
variable.

--
Regards,
C.C.Chakkaradeep,
Novatium Solutions Limited,Chennai.
http://www.novatium.com
http://www.yoper.com

--
"Sometimes it's better not to ask - or to listen - when people tell you
something can't be done. I didnt ask for permission or approval. I just went
ahead and did it."  - from "Direct from Dell"
From praveen at symonds.net  Tue Apr  4 22:05:48 2006
From: praveen at symonds.net (Praveen Kumar)
Date: Wed Apr  5 10:35:34 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] ssh login to remote in www.
In-Reply-To: <d05619590604040602n474d7d89lb1f86fedce125cec@mail.gmail.com>
References: <d05619590604040602n474d7d89lb1f86fedce125cec@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <4433502C.3050509@symonds.net>

nava ladi wrote:

> Hi all,I need a website which provides a web based ssh login facility
> to remote system where i have a account.I can not use my shell and
> terminal because lot of security restriction in my University.thx
> geeks.

Maybe you would like to try corkscrew[1]. It tunnels the SSH over a
HTTP/HTTPS proxy. After downloading/installing corkscrew binary and
having it in your path, you can use the ProxyCommand in ssh (with -o
switch) as follows.

ProxyCommand corkscrew <your-proxy> <your-proxy-port> %h %p

Note that corkscrew can be used to tunnel any TCP traffic over
HTTP/HTTPS proxy and it works like a charm.

HTH.

[1] - http://www.agroman.net/corkscrew/

-- 
Praveen Kumar
http://journal.praveen.ws
From cyborg4k at yahoo.com  Tue Apr  4 22:21:19 2006
From: cyborg4k at yahoo.com (Shakthi Kannan)
Date: Wed Apr  5 10:51:37 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] user settings
In-Reply-To: <20060405044638.94405.qmail@web60325.mail.yahoo.com>
Message-ID: <20060405052119.12129.qmail@web50211.mail.yahoo.com>

Hi Umar,

--- U M A R <amu_314@yahoo.com> wrote:
> May I know how to preserve user settings to
> build a livecd.

Check out the saveconfig script from Knoppix.

http://www.oreillynet.com/sysadmin/blog/2004/11/remaster_knoppix_without_remas.html

You can save the configuration to USB thumb drive or
hard disk, and restore it when you use the LiveCD
again.

SK

Shakthi Kannan
http://www.shakthimaan.com

From andyetitmoves at gmail.com  Wed Apr  5 12:30:02 2006
From: andyetitmoves at gmail.com (Ramkumar R)
Date: Wed Apr  5 12:30:20 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] using sed
In-Reply-To: <a54a308e0604042152q148126b9t9f6e9ae0d9c35263@mail.gmail.com>
References: <a54a308e0604040506k6d0f239ey603e1b94130bf1d8@mail.gmail.com>
	<9a9bfc170604040517v65318418i924133e3e8d22ac3@mail.gmail.com>
	<a54a308e0604040611i2b5cd3dbx9a94962263face8f@mail.gmail.com>
	<a54a308e0604042152q148126b9t9f6e9ae0d9c35263@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <9a9bfc170604050000j5b7cfa81n16020c921a8cff7f@mail.gmail.com>

> > Thanks a lot!, it worked. But where did you manage to get these commands
> of sed?...am googling but am not able to get a gud tutorial of sed
> commands....

well... help was there on your comp... `info sed`! anyway, that was
more of a mistake in the regular expression rather than sed commands..
the s command just matches each line with the regexp given and
replaces it as you say. your earlier pattern just matched till the =
.. as a matter of fact, the only thing i use sed for is the s command,
anything more complex and i go for perl :)

>  It works perfect !. Now am not able to pass this 177 to sed as a variable.

start=`grep -n -F "[xdmcp]" /etc/X11/gdm/gdm.conf | awk -F: '{print $1}' `
[ x$start != x ] && sed -e "$start,190 s/Enable=.*/Enable=true/;"
/etc/X11/gdm/gdm.conf > gdm.new

i dunno if u can do this with a single sed script... even if not, i
guess using perl to loop over and finish it off with a single script
would be better and less error prone. (as a matter of fact, you can
write a pretty good ini/conf type file parser (gdm config etc.) in
shell script. i wrote one in zsh for finding out the current firefox
profile using ~/.mozilla/firefox/profiles.ini, so that i could use the
history file for url completion. could post it here if u want)

it moves on...

--
April 1: This is the day upon which we are reminded of
what we are on the other three hundred and sixty-four.
          -- Mark Twain, "Pudd'nhead Wilson's Calendar"

From cyborg4k at yahoo.com  Wed Apr  5 02:05:29 2006
From: cyborg4k at yahoo.com (Shakthi Kannan)
Date: Wed Apr  5 14:35:47 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] unable to scp in FC4
In-Reply-To: <37a4e4800604050050t7f7f8addj939568935a834d51@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <20060405090529.5822.qmail@web50215.mail.yahoo.com>

Hi Srinivas,

--- srinivas masna <srinivasmasna@gmail.com> wrote:
> i'm using FC4. previously i was having a kernel
> 2.6.11.... i updated it by
> using the command "yum update" and my kernel changed
> to 2.6.15-1.1831_FC4.
> 
> when i try to transfer a file using scp

scp has nothing to do with your kernel upgrade. 

> it doesn't
> work. but it used to work
> before i did yum update.

I guess yum update has updated your scp and /etc
configuration files.

> the ouput of scp is as follows:
> 
> [root@localhost ~]# scp -r ~/aaa/project/serializer

I use:

 scp -r directory/ user@host:/path/to/directory

For example:

 scp -r foo/ david@192.168.0.1:/home/david

You can add an entry for 192.168.0.1 in /etc/hosts to
use a name instead of an IP address.

Can you check if ssh into the target system works?

SK

--
Shakthi Kannan
http://www.shakthimaan.com

> > however, there are no compilation errors from  make ..

> exists. (yes a file named [).

From cyborg4k at yahoo.com  Wed Apr  5 03:33:25 2006
From: cyborg4k at yahoo.com (Shakthi Kannan)
Date: Wed Apr  5 16:03:52 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] unable to scp in FC4
In-Reply-To: <20060405090529.5822.qmail@web50215.mail.yahoo.com>
Message-ID: <20060405103326.28218.qmail@web50207.mail.yahoo.com>

Hi Srinivas,

Please don't directly reply to a digest. 

I'll reply to your queries here (with the above
subject line):

--- Srinivas wrote:
> yes, i am able to ssh into the remote system. 

Ok.

> after i logged into the
> remote system i tried to do scp from the remote 
> system but still it didn't work.

I didn't ask you to test this. For this to work, you
should be running sshd in your host system.

I thought you were trying to copy from host system to
remote system.

> scp -r root@10.94.4.81:~/aaa/project/serializer
> ~/aaa/project/

-r should be followed by the local directory that you
want to transfer to the remote system. Please check my
syntax example.

Regards,

SK

Shakthi Kannan
http://www.shakthimaan.com

Hi Siva,

--- Siva GNU/Linux <linux.siva@yahoo.com> wrote:
> they give  Huawei SmartAX MT800 ADSL router and

Is it a 4-port router?

> asked
> us to put a IP in the range of 192.168.1.1.

192.168.1.1 is not a range. 

It should be mentioned as any host in the
192.168.1.0/24 network.

> i want to provide a secure Internet access for my
> LAN
> users,

Secure the router, perhaps?

> then if i made a linux router should i change the IP
> address range for my LAN clients? (because i am
> using
> DNS and mail servers internally)

> for some info on how to setup time based control with Squid

> http://www.linuxhomenetworking.com/linux-adv/squid.htm


Thanks for the link. I had visited the link before. Squid allows us to have
a time frame , say, from morning 7.00 am to 12.00 pm or from evening 8.00 pm
to 11.00 pm. But we cannot allow the Squid to allow the user to browse 1
hr/day.This link clearly explains why,
http://www.mail-archive.com/squid-users@squid-cache.org/msg34204.html

So am finally put down to write my own program which handles this.

From aanjhan7 at hotmail.com  Wed Apr  5 14:13:32 2006
From: aanjhan7 at hotmail.com (Aanjhan R)
Date: Wed Apr  5 19:44:51 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] [OT] Ankit fadia
Message-ID: <BAY110-F93E1500A5182DFE3EDFB19BCB0@phx.gbl>


Hello All,

A small article on Mr. Ankit Fadia. Written by Mr. Prabhat.
FYI


"++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++"

Dear All,

Yesterday (03-04-2006)I attended a seminar by a so-called "Hacking Guru"
Ankit Fadia, at DAVV, Indore (MP) auditorium. I just want to share my
feelings with you.

The Seminar was a complete failure, though it was attended by about well
over 100 people, but was a complete disaster.

The very first thing by which I was offended badly was using the sacred word
"Hacking" to demonstrate something we, the hackers, call cracking. The
seminar topic was "Ethical Hacking", now I want to ask Mr Fadia, what is
unethical about hacking ? Hacking is very positive word and there in no need
to put "Ethical" before it. By the way his seminar topic should be "Ethical
Cracking".

If you really want to become a hacker, please read an article by a real
hacker, Eric Steven Raymond (ESR). The man who changed the history by
writing a paper "Cathedral and Bazaar". please read the article here :
http://www.catb.org/~esr/faqs/hacker-howto.html<http://www.catb.org/%7Eesr/faqs/hacker-howto.html>

The people who can not differentiate between hacking and cracking, should
read an article by the GOD of hackers Richad M Stallman (RMS), the man who
started GNU movement all by himself. The gcc (compiler), gdb (debugger),
emacs (editor) are some of the most popular softwares in the world written
by him. Please read the article here :
http://www.outpost9.com/reference/jargon/jargon_69.html

The things Fadia demonstrated were ancient techniques used by crackers to
break into some one's machine. Now a days even 10 year olds can download
these tools from Internet to control others'  machines. Can we call them
hackers ??  If he calls it hacking, I doubt if he understands the term even
"Cracking", leave hacking altogether. This childish behavior is called
script kiddie.

IP spoofing, SQL Injection, password cracking softwares, Trojan horse
programs, these are the tools of cyber criminals. So I wonder what is the
significance of the term "Ethical" here ??

In the entire session I kept waiting for some program or utility, written by
himself. But I don't thing he had something like this to share with
audience. The entire session was demonstration of third party utilities, and
the saddest thing was no  mention of the name of any author of any utility.
He didn't care to give some credits to the utility developers. What a shame
!!!

Mr Fadia, I real hacker always respect the creativity of others, and before
using their work proper credits are given, this is the hacker's attitude.
It's not like that, you download something from Internet, use it and forget
the person, who made it. That's pretty mean.

Second most annoying thing was that he calls himself a "hacker" and was
using a Windows XP operating system ????

I have been in to computers for the past 10 years and I never come across
any real hacker who uses Windows. I met Brian(Apache creator), Andy Cleen,
Alon cox, Rusty (all networking gods), RMS (the GOD himself) but all of them
were using some or other form of Unix or Linux.

Come on, MR Fadia, Windows is the worst OS in the world, full of security
holes, so what is the point to break into a  Windows machine ???? What do
you want to prove ????

He only once mentioned Linux, just to tell how you can use it's live CD to
boot a Windows machine and cracke the password.

Actually, before attending the seminar, I Googled a lot about Fadia and his
work. But what I could find was self acclaiming statement by Fadia about
himself and his future and just crap, crap and crap by technology illiterate
Indian news papers' reports.

I just want to share my findings with you.

Vulnerabilities patches by Fadia          =     0 (He may know how to break
in, but doesn't know how to fix up)
Bugtraq id's by Fadia                          =     0
Hacking / Security tool by fadia           =     0 (He simply Goolge and
download the tools from Internet, that's not cracking. Actual cracker
                                                                   is the
programmer, but Fadia never ever gives due credits. Now that's not hacking,
that's
                                                                   stealing)
Any open source software by Fadia     =    0 (He is afraid of suggesting
Linux to people, 'coz it's secure)
Any Linux or Windows software security patch   =     0
Any recommendation or recognition by Real Hacker Community   =     0 (They
laugh at him. He is just a kid)
Software / Cryptography patents by Fadia        =     0
Algorithms by Fadia                                       =     0
Any official citation by FBI/CIA/CBI for Fadia   =     0 (They don't even
bother about any explanation)
Any confirmation of his self-claims                  =     0 (Nobody, expect
him knows, if they are real)
Any confirmation of him decrypting Osama's message        =     0
(Hahahahahahahaha)
Any original technical tutorial or book by Fadia   =    0 (He simply copy
the things and never he never ever gives due credits to the

original authors.)
Any originality in his tutes or books             =     0 (Hahahahahahaha)
Skill level of Fadia                                     =     Only God
knows !!!


I tried to read a few books by him, but to my wonder some part of his books
are nothing but simple "copy and paste" material from well known sites for
Windows registry editing. Please visit www.winguides.com and compare the
material with his first book. Oh God !  this is the clear violation of
intellectual property rights of the website. Please inform the webmaster. I
have done it already.

I was astonished by the course he came to promote here, "Ethical hacker
certified by Ankit Fadia" ! He sill is child in hacking field, and he is
giving the certificates for hacking ?????  And worst thing, Reliance web
world is promoting it. What a shame !!!  Have all gone mad ? Can't they see
?

Unfortunately, question and answer round was cut from the seminar, that's
also because of Fadia arrived there one hour late. Well, that's India's
celebrity style statement. Otherwise, I would have asked all these questions
to him there only.

Anyways, I went to him at the end of the seminar, and asked if Windows is so
vulnerable, can he suggest audience to use Linux rather than Windows. And
the reply came was straight "NO". What a shame ???

I understood the reason, why he said no. The reason is same why Microsoft
does not patch up it's OS. Plain economics. If you make system secure with
Linux who is going to ask for people like Fadia, so called "security expert"
???

I want to make an appeal to all of you, please make all of your friends
aware of these facts. Let one should not get undeserved advantage. I also
want to appeal news papers, please do not make a hero out of nothing. Stop
polluting the honest media by prejudiced reports.

And at the end I want to tell Mr Fadia, that I don't have any personal
problem with you or your achievements, but please behave properly in hacking
community. We hackers are very positive people we never ever try to harm
anybody, until he comes to our or our philosophy's way. Please stop calling
your self a hacker, if does not understand the hacker culture.

And for god sake, stop behaving like a child, now you are in college, so
GROW UP !!!


Prabhat.

"++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++"


Regards,
Aanjhan
-----------------------
Alias : tuxmaniac
Locations : irc.freenode.net: #gnu-india, #linux-india,      #ubuntu-in
Website: http://www.tuxmaniac.com
----------------------

From rajasuperman at gmail.com  Thu Apr  6 06:33:17 2006
From: rajasuperman at gmail.com (Raja Subramanian)

Subject: [Ilugc] regarding browsing restriction to users
In-Reply-To: <a54a308e0604050435t4b9f5a53yf05abe9c2db565b9@mail.gmail.com>
References: <a54a308e0604050030i6371feaend52c8c31b2b3ac10@mail.gmail.com>
	<3b020fee0604050418le006b9cm6101ef41f42e7e28@mail.gmail.com>
	<a54a308e0604050435t4b9f5a53yf05abe9c2db565b9@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <92f9a9560604051803g2497bf9ake5ddb12bb582dfa8@mail.gmail.com>

Hi,

On 4/5/06, Chakkaradeep C C <chaks.yoper@gmail.com> wrote:
> So am finally put down to write my own program which handles this.

Writing an external authenticator for Squid is very easy.  If you program
in a high level language (insert your favourite language starting with P)
the whole project could just be an evening's hack.

I'm unable to point you to the right docs, sorry.  If you have problems,
please post.

However, I'm unable to understand what 1 hr browsing means...

Is it 1hr counting from first successful proxy access of the day?

- Raja

From cyborg4k at yahoo.com  Wed Apr  5 22:21:20 2006
From: cyborg4k at yahoo.com (Shakthi Kannan)
Date: Thu Apr  6 10:51:27 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] Fedora 5- wireless configuration help
In-Reply-To: <Pine.LNX.4.58.0604060008060.9853@chi.spunge.org>
Message-ID: <20060406052120.16260.qmail@web50209.mail.yahoo.com>

Hi Carti,

--- carti <carti@chi.spunge.org> wrote:
> On searching through the google, I found the link
> "http://fedoranews.org/cms/node/478" and followed

Homework done :)

> the procedures. But it
> is not connecting. 

You should first try to connect without wireless
encryption. You can later play with encryption.

Open a terminal, and post output of:

 /sbin/ifconfig -a
 /sbin/iwconfig -a
 /sbin/lsmod
 cat /etc/resolv.conf
 /sbin/route -n

Note, you can redirect output to a file:

 /sbin/lsmod > lsmod.txt

SK

--
Shakthi Kannan
http://www.shakthimaan.com

Hi Carti,

--- carti <carti@chi.spunge.org> wrote:
> I wanted this without affecting the
> current single
> partion(C: which is 60GB).

All recent distros setup the dual partition for you.
 
> I dont know
> exactly which is better.

Distros differ primarily in the package management
system. Choice of distro is a personal one.

> Fedora i found rich set of programming environment

You can use your programming tools with any distro.

> I
> dont want too much of
> games or other features like too many GUIS like.

Install whichever tools/packages you want. You have
the freedom to do what you want.

> Googling does not help in this regard

GNU/Linux on Dell laptops:
http://www.linux-on-laptops.com/dell.html

Installing SuSE 10 on Dell 6000:
http://en.opensuse.org/Installing_SuSE_10_on_DELL_6000_Laptop

Dell Inspiron6000 Gentoo install:
http://socrates.homelinux.org/index.php?page=DellInspiron6000

Mandrake/Ubuntu on Dell 6000:
http://www.geetduggal.com/linux_on_inspiron_6000.html

FC4 on Dell Inspiron 6000:
http://www.redhat.com/archives/fedora-list/2005-September/msg02156.html

Gentoo on Inspiron 6000:
http://www.stanford.edu/~rashmisu/linux.html

Have fun,

hai,

      FYI tomcat's default port is 8080. you can try like this
http://192.9.200.62:8080/examples. If you are running any proxy server on
this port, you will have to play arround with catalina files. it should be
there in /usr/local/tomcat/bin/catalina.properties.

From akumar at ee.iitm.ac.in  Thu Apr  6 14:34:23 2006
From: akumar at ee.iitm.ac.in (Kumar Appaiah)
Date: Thu Apr  6 14:21:06 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] how to recompile kernel
In-Reply-To: <4434D355.6020708@gmail.com>
References: <4434D355.6020708@gmail.com>
Message-ID: <20060406090423.GA4316@localhost>

On Thu, Apr 06, 2006 at 02:07:41PM +0530, Prasanna Kumar wrote:
> hi all,
> i have been using linux for more than a year.
> On which cases we need to recompile the kernel ...  Iam eager to know 
> how to recompile ther kernel
> can anybody send the links and tuturials if any available .....
> thanks

(My) Reasons why you would want to recompile a kernel:

1. A missing driver has to be compiled into the kernel.
2. Add source patches for enhanced desktop performance.
3. Trim the kernel by removing unnecessary drivers and modules (use
   with caution!)
4. For the fun of watching your processor fan speed and temperature
   hit the ceiling on GKrellm!

So, you can compile the kernel for fun and learning how to do it; you
will surely come across some other situation where you might need it,
so it is better to learn now...

There are distribution specific as well as generic ways of compiling
your kernel. So, just Google for compile kernel + <distro>. Or, as
mentioned in an earlier post, see the README file in the kernel source
directory.

HTH.

Kumar
-- 
Kumar Appaiah,
462, Jamuna Hostel,
Indian Institute of Technology Madras,
Chennai - 600 036

From anant at kix.in  Thu Apr  6 14:28:27 2006
From: anant at kix.in (Anant Narayanan)
Date: Thu Apr  6 14:29:07 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] how to recompile kernel
In-Reply-To: <4434D674.1040305@gmail.com>
References: <4434D355.6020708@gmail.com>	<4cba61b90604060139y645d329fl2c70e40ae2ca3663@mail.gmail.com>
	<4434D674.1040305@gmail.com>
Message-ID: <4434D833.2080708@kix.in>

Prasanna,

> 
>    so i have to place the source of the kernel in
> 
>   /usr/src/linux  and then how to recompile it is there any utility available ...

/usr/src/linux is usually a symlink to the actual directory of your
kernel source.

Once you are in the directory of your kernel source, type:

make menuconfig

and you will get a nice interface to configure your kernel. After you're
done, save your changes and then type:

make && make modules_install

to recompile your kernel. The kernel image will then be located in
arch/i386/bzImage; which you may have to copy to your boot drive, and
point grub (or your bootloader) to it. These instructions are valid only
for the 2.6.x kernels.

Hope this helps.
-- 
Anant

Find Freedom, Go Open Source!
http://www.kix.in/
From gopal at gopalarathnam.com  Thu Apr  6 14:35:00 2006
From: gopal at gopalarathnam.com (Gopalarathnam Venkatesan)

Subject: [Ilugc] how to recompile kernel
In-Reply-To: <4434D833.2080708@kix.in>
References: <4434D355.6020708@gmail.com>
	<4cba61b90604060139y645d329fl2c70e40ae2ca3663@mail.gmail.com>
	<4434D674.1040305@gmail.com> <4434D833.2080708@kix.in>
Message-ID: <4cba61b90604060205y32558ac1i6f5e5c8c5611008a@mail.gmail.com>

On 4/6/06, Anant Narayanan <anant@kix.in> wrote:
> Once you are in the directory of your kernel source, type:
>
> make menuconfig

Its always advisable to do a "make mrproper" first before starting to configure.
And doing a "make oldconfig" (u need to zcat /proc/config.gz >.config
before this) will set the default options against your running kernel,
then you can begin with selecting/deselecting with "make menuconfig".

--
Gopalarathnam Venkatesan
http://gopalarathnam.com/

From srinivasg at esntechnologies.co.in  Thu Apr  6 17:53:34 2006
From: srinivasg at esntechnologies.co.in (Srinivas G.)
Date: Thu Apr  6 17:54:31 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] how to recompile kernel 
Message-ID: <3AEC1E10243A314391FE9C01CD65429B3B4B37@mail.esn.co.in>


Prasanna kumar wrote:
> hi all,
> i have been using linux for more than a year.
> On which cases we need to recompile the kernel ...  Iam eager to know
> how to recompile ther kernel
> can anybody send the links and tuturials if any available .....
> thanks

Dear Kumar,

I have recompiled the kernel long back to observe the network packets
flow in the kernel. To that end, I have modified the some of the network
kernel modules and build the new kernel. I booted the build kernel and I
got what is want.

Please find the steps to recompile the kernel OR to build a new kernel
Image below. (The first 8 steps are required to build a new kernel
image)

I think you require the steps 9 to 15.

1. Download the required kernel source file i.e *.tar.gz from
www.kernel.org

2. Copy the downloaded file into /usr/src directory and untar the file.

3. Change the permissions of the file using the command:
	# chown -R root:root <directory name>
	where <directory name> is source directory name like
linux-2.6.10.

4. Create the link to the above linux directory
	# ln -s <directory name> linux(link name)

5. make mrproper

6. make clean

7. make menuconfig

8. make prepare-all

	The steps 5-8 required to change the version.h file. If the file
does not exists create it.

Note: No need to change any modifications to Makefile - EXTRAVERSION
symbol. If we add anything it will append in version.h file.

9. make menuconfig - do the modifications.

10. make clean

11. make bzImage - creates the image file under i386
directory.(arch/i836/boot/bzImage)

12. make modules.

13. make modules_install

14. make install - This will copy the bzImage and system.map files into
/boot directory and also updates the grub.conf files.

15. Reboot the system.

Regards,
Srinivas G

From binand at gmail.com  Thu Apr  6 20:54:51 2006

References: <20060405091621.BA6521DB275@www.ae.iitm.ac.in>
	<37a4e4800604050311j2a99a19ep2745144f9eefd0aa@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <d2a92d610604061154s6e4fe722q94d7a110f5c62e99@mail.gmail.com>

On 05/04/06, srinivas masna <srinivasmasna@gmail.com> wrote:
> my terminal looks as follows :
> Note: "Hello World" comes because  "echo Hello World" is added into .bashrc
> of my system

If you have stuff being echo'ed from your startup files, scp will
fail. Remove such stuff.

If you really need to echo, then do it within a construct like
(assuming you don't have PS1 customization in your startup scripts):

if [ -n "$PS1" ]; then
   echo whatever
fi

The correct solution is to figure out if the startup file is being
called from a login/interactive shell or not correctly, but doing that
is left as an exercise to the reader.

Binand
From binand at gmail.com  Thu Apr  6 21:02:46 2006
From: binand at gmail.com (Binand Sethumadhavan)
Date: Fri Apr  7 00:32:54 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] regarding bsnl data one connection
In-Reply-To: <20060405103706.73155.qmail@web37804.mail.mud.yahoo.com>
References: <20060405103706.73155.qmail@web37804.mail.mud.yahoo.com>
Message-ID: <d2a92d610604061202s329d10ccxc23c91a2a1a5f49e@mail.gmail.com>

On 05/04/06, Siva GNU/Linux <linux.siva@yahoo.com> wrote:
> i have a plan to make my linux box as a router (by
> using 2 ethernet cards)if i made this setup,should i
> implement NAT again? because i think the BSNL peoples
> already NATed the IP by their Router.
> then if i made a linux router should i change the IP
> address range for my LAN clients? (because i am using
> DNS and mail servers internally)

No, you don't need to. You just need to forward IP packets between
your interfaces.

sysctl -w net.ipv4.ip_forward=0

(Add an entry in /etc/sysctl.conf for this to be persistent). Also,
have your routing setup correctly.

To be truly using the full functionality of this, you LAN should be on
a different subnet.

Also, you can try to experiment with a bridged setup on your server :)
It needs to be dedicated, though.

Binand

On Fri, 2006-04-07 at 03:33 +0530, Vasudevan A wrote:
> On 4/7/06, Rahul Sundaram <sundaram@fedoraproject.org> wrote:
> > On Thu, 2006-04-06 at 10:15 +0530, Mohamed Imran K R wrote:
> > > hi all
> > >        i have installed fc5 but i am in no position to do a full install( no
> > > options there).
> > > got stuck up with using pirut( package management utility integrated with
> > > yum) but it was fetching every thing from the web.
> >
> > You can configure a local yum repository
> >
> > http://www.city-fan.org/tips/YumRepoFromImages
> >
> > > anyways to do a fresh full everything install
> >
> > Yes. Selecting all the different groups. Right clicking on a group will
> > give you a menu option to install all the optional packages more easily
> > but I wouldnt recommend installing all the packages given in the media.
> >
> > Rahul
> >
> hi,
> yum --help gives several options. One of the option is  'yum localinstall'
> Does localibntall installs from CD

Yum localinstall will check the local filesystem to resolve dependencies
or use the repositories to resolve them. If you have downloaded a
package and want to resolve dependencies for it without having to
download it again, you can run localinstall on them. Check the man page
of yum and http://fedora.redhat.com/docs/yum/ for more information on
this. 


Rahul

If it turns out to be the gentoo 2006.0 livecd with gui installer, i can
advice u that u will need really a lot of patience. KDE and oo will take
hours to compile. Also u can install properly only with a running internet
connection, something like a broadband on ethernet card. I tried the
install. But after 6 long hours on a pentium 4 2.8 ghz with 512 mbram, i got
irritated and installed arch linux instead.

> aanjhan , You have to understand one thing, many hackers may like to use
linux, but one thing is that i wrote a small morse decoder when i was 12. I
had only win ME then. My parents thought I'd ruin my computer by
uninstalling windows. So finally 4 months ago i installed linux(FC3) as a
dual boot with XP.
Now I am using arch linux with XP. I have found win XP something like a
rescue OS. When internet connection cant be setup on linux ido it on
windows, like my dialup,(now broadband usb modem etc.) It may have some
security holes, but i am not running a server with Bill Gates' bank details.
So i dont find any problem since AVG free can patch it up. Linux is probably
the best, but u cannot blame those who are using XP because, it is better
looking outside(no dependencies unssatisfied, double click and file executes
or compiles etc.)
Also Fadia is no idiot if he could pass the RHCE by answering all the
questions at the age of 14( source The Hindu) and MSCE is not easy either,
he did it.
Ethical hacking is a term that is in use now to quote some examples read
http://computing-dictionary.thefreedictionary.com/ethical+hacker
ttp://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special%3ASearch&search=ethical+hacker&fulltext=Search

Also NOT ALL ARE SURE OF THE TERM HACKING. when i told my mother i wanted to
be a hacker, she planned to take me to a doctor to check my brain, to see
why i got the twisted ideas. Even BBC confuses the terms.

Compiles!!!  What do you do with the missing dll hell?  Have you heard
of magic invented by  FLOSS people like  APT, YUM that can  resolve
all dependencies. When I want to install something to my Debian
machine, I just do

apititude install something

A little later phewwwwwwww! I would have something on my machine. The
magic of APT will download all incredients to cook something on my
machine. Actually it comes ready to eat. You can also download it raw,
modify as you wish and cook it on your machine.

Gentoo has a magic called portage. Just do

emerge something

and phewwwwwwwwwww!!!, something would be cooked and ready to run. How
long it takes to cook  depends on how much cook and the power of your
fire. The recipe for cooking something on your machine is built into
portage. It will download all incredients and cook it for you. Yea you
can also download pre-cooked stuffs. Those are called something.bin
food in Gentoo. If you ask me who's the chef behind it, its Daniel
Robbins.

He was off to MS kitchen to try mix MS and Open Source cuisine. He
isn't there anymore though.

Subject: [Ilugc] read call in block driver

Hello all,
I am working with flash, a  block driver.
When i do  a simple read system call for 2 times to get sector  data and 
each time 512 bytes(1 sector),
call: read(fd, ubuf, 512);
... the varaible NumSectors in the block driver for the first read is 2 
and for second read is 0.
The data read to ubuf is also different.

The parameter that is passed as number of bytes from read call  is not 
considered in the driver and 2 sectors are read in the driver.

Can anyone tell me how the NumSectors gets assigned in the driver & how 
it is related to  "CURRENT->current_nr_sectors" .

Thanks
Sudheer

Talk 1 : Mozilla RAD Platform (1Hr)

Speaker: Gopalarathnam Venkatesan

Abstract:

The Mozilla Platform is a large software development tool that is a
modern blend of XML document processing, scripting languages, and
software objects. It is used to create interactive, user-focused
applications. This talk also covers building Mozilla.

Talk 2: USB and GNU/Linux - An Overview (30Min)

Abstract : 

Introduction about the USB Support implemented at Kernel & User space
Level and how it can be used in GNU/Linux System.

From animeshs at gmail.com  Sat Apr  8 10:45:38 2006
From: animeshs at gmail.com (Animesh Singh)
Date: Sat Apr  8 10:45:54 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] read call in block driver
In-Reply-To: <4436635B.4080101@gmail.com>
References: <4436635B.4080101@gmail.com>
Message-ID: <e8fef13b0604072215l32b64ab5tf4548016fb5c2c0@mail.gmail.com>

Morning Sudhir,

When i do  a simple read system call for 2 times to get sector  data and
> each time 512 bytes(1 sector),
> call: read(fd, ubuf, 512);
> ... the varaible NumSectors in the block driver for the first read is 2
> and for second read is 0.


<snip>
A return value greater than or equal to 0, instead, tells the calling
program how many bytes have been successfully transferred. If some data is
transferred correctly and then an error happens, the return value must be
the count of bytes successfully transferred, and the error does not get
reported until the next time the function is called. Implementing this
convention requires, of course, that your driver remember that the error has
occurred so that it can return the error status in the future.

The data read to ubuf is also different.
>
> The parameter that is passed as number of bytes from read call  is not
> considered in the driver and 2 sectors are read in the driver.

<snip>
 What must be missing in your code for read call,  "there is no data, but it
may arrive later." In this case, the read system call should block. ( My
Guess, as code is not available ;) )


Can anyone tell me how the NumSectors gets assigned in the driver & how
> it is related to  "CURRENT->current_nr_sectors" .

<snip>
If there is no filesystem in the device, you just get the probe
transfers.Some filesystems have their magic number in the first sector, and
some have it later in the device.

To detail it , depends on your code, whether you making filesystem on device
or the other way.

Would be better if you paste the code for any explanation.

Animesh.

From rajasuperman at gmail.com  Sun Apr  9 13:42:13 2006
From: rajasuperman at gmail.com (Raja Subramanian)
Date: Sun Apr  9 13:42:21 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] using RPM packages in debian
In-Reply-To: <aec5a5f80604082349s7aaa77abx3af6226d6fbfaff5@mail.gmail.com>
References: <aec5a5f80604082349s7aaa77abx3af6226d6fbfaff5@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <92f9a9560604090112h7ca4aa5fr362cad1e2d7da9c4@mail.gmail.com>

Hi,

On 4/9/06, Balachandran Sivakumar <contactsbala@gmail.com> wrote:
>                Is there anyway in which RPM packages can be used with
> the Debian.I use debian sarge 3.1r0

I would not recommend installing any unofficial packages on a debian box.
The package may not follow the debian FHS, and you may have problems
later on.  Read: http://www.debian.org/doc/packaging-manuals/fhs/.

I would recommend that you extract the rpm package (like a tgz archive)
and manually move the files into /usr/local/<package-name>.

You don't even need rpm to be installed to extract rpm files. rpm files are
infact gzipped cpio archives (preceeded by a small rpm header).  You
should be able to find an "rpm2cpio" script on the web that will help you
unpack an rpm file.

- Raja
From trshash84 at gmail.com  Sun Apr  9 13:58:33 2006

From rajasuperman at gmail.com  Sun Apr  9 14:41:32 2006
From: rajasuperman at gmail.com (Raja Subramanian)
Date: Sun Apr  9 14:41:41 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] XUL resources
Message-ID: <92f9a9560604090211p6eda61e3q6fcdc86935c65772@mail.gmail.com>

Hi,

Following Gopal's Moz/XUL talk at the last LUG meet, here are some
XUL links to try out:


Cool XUL demos:
    http://games.mozdev.org/
    http://robin.sf.net
    http://www.atmail.com  -- commercial xul webmail client

All Mozilla apps - Firefox, Thunderbird, Calendar, are XUL apps too.


XUL tutorials:
    http://www.xulplanet.com/tutorials/xultu/

    Introducing XUL - The 'Net's Biggest Secret: Part 1,2,3 --
            http://www.sitepoint.com/articlelist/210

    Luxor: The "Linux Kernel" for Desktop Apps -- fantastic comparison
    bewteen XUL and Java Swing.
        http://luxor-xul.sourceforge.net/talk/vanx-jul-2002/slides.html


XUL reference:
    http://www.xulplanet.org/
    http://luxor-xul.sourceforge.net/xulref/  -- resembles javadoc


XUL apps are mostly powered by Javascript.  Sadly, Javascript is the
most misunderstood language on the planet and most people think it's
just for annoying popup ads.  More at:
    http://www.crockford.com/javascript/
    http://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Core_JavaScript_1.5_Guide

Gopal: can you please post that JS article we discussed?


There is only XUL!

- Raja
